孔.definition: hole; CL:個|个[ge4]; classifier for cave dwellings

孔乙己.definition: Kong Yiji, protagonist of a short story of the same name by Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅[Lu3 Xun4] depicting the life of a poor, unsuccessful scholar who clings to his Confucian ideals despite his dismal circumstances

孔叢子.definition: the K'ung family Masters' anthology, collection of dialogues between Confucius and his disciples, possibly forged in third century by Wang Su 王肅|王肃[Wang2 Su4]

孔夫子.definition: Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔子[Kong3 zi3]

孔子.definition: Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3]

孔子學院.definition: Confucius Institute, organization established internationally by the PRC, promoting Chinese language and culture

孔子家語.definition: The School Sayings of Confucius, a supplement to the Analects; abbr. to 家語|家语[Jia1 yu3]

孔孟之道.definition: the teaching of Confucius and Mencius

孔尚任.definition: Kong Shangren (1648-1718), Qing dramatist and poet, author of The Peach Blossom Fan 桃花扇[Tao2 hua1 Shan4]

孔方兄.definition: (coll., humorous) money (so named because in former times, Chinese coins had a square hole in the middle)

孔明.definition: courtesy name of Zhuge Liang 諸葛亮|诸葛亮[Zhu1 ge3 Liang4]

孔明燈.definition: sky lantern (miniature hot-air balloon used during festivals)

孔林.definition: the Confucius family mausoleum at Qufu 曲阜, rebuilt and extended by every dynasty

孔融.definition: Kong Rong (153-208), poet of the Three Kingdoms period

孔融讓梨.definition: Kong Rong giving up pears, classic moral story about Kong Rong 孔融[Kong3 Rong2] picking up smaller pears while leaving the bigger ones to his older brothers, still used nowadays to educate the young on courtesy and modesty

孔道.definition: opening providing access; the teaching of Confucius

孔院.definition: Confucius Institute (abbr. for 孔子學院|孔子学院[Kong3zi3 Xue2yuan4])

孔雀女.definition: (Internet slang) spoiled city girl from a rich family
